intro: Chiazospermum erectum, commonly known as the upright chia plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain oily seeds. The plant typically grows in dry, temperate climates and thrives in well-drained soils. Its seeds are rich in omega-3 fatty acids and are often used in culinary and medicinal applications. The botanical features of Chiazospermum erectum make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
